Newman Salesperson of the year Email: rzunt@jcnewman.com In Loving Memory of Our Friend Stefan Bastiaenssens In Loving Memory of Our Friend Stefan Bastiaenssens Territory: All Territories outside the US; mainly Europe Year Started with the Company: 2018 Favorite JCN Cigar: Black Diamond Hobbies/Interests: Cigars, wine, beer, music fitness. Favorite Thing About the Cigar Industry: The bond that is created between two people that smoke. You can enter a cigar room or lounge without knowing anyone and leave it having made many new friends! Favorite Place to Travel: All countries in the Carribean Favorite Newman Memory: I love all members of the family, but Bobby was the first one I met. He picked me up at the airport when I flew over applying for the job and the first thing he said was: ‚ÄúI am Bobby, and this is Jeanny‚Äù. Next thing I know I am showing pictures of me and my family. Couldn‚Äôt think of a warmer welcome. Favorite Quote: ‚ÄúHappiness is about a good meal, a good cigar, and a good woman, or a bad woman, depending on how much happiness you can handle‚Äù Fun Fact: Stefan ran a cigar magazine for a number of years before joining the J.C. Newman Team. Ybor City Cigar Festival returns to Centennial Park | FOX 13 Tampa Bay News Weather Sports Good Day We Live Here Contests More Watch Live Expand / Collapse search ‚ò∞ Search site News Top Stories Local Tampa Bay News Florida Tonight National FOX 13 Investigates Consumer Health Politics Seen on TV Daily Newsletter FOX News Sunday Weather SkyTower Radar Views Interactive Radar Live Webcams Marine Weather Weather Alerts Hurricane Safety Tracking the Tropics MyFoxHurricane FOX Weather Sports Buccaneers Rays Lightning No Off Days with Scott Smith Weekly Fishing Report High School Sports Good Day Traffic Charley's World Hometown Heroes Extraordinary Ordinaries Recipes First Birthdays We Live Here What's Right Dinner DeeAs One Tank Trips Theme Parks Made in Tampa Bay Recipes, Food & Drink Tampa Bay History Care Force Watch Live How To Stream Live FOX 13 Newscasts LiveNOW from FOX FOX Weather FOX Soul FOX Live Feed Central NASA TV Money Consumer Personal Finance The Economy Small Business Entertainment Headlines Trending Stories FOX Shows What's on FOX 13 Contests FOX Local Book Club Regional News Orlando News - FOX 35 Orlando Gainesville News - FOX 51 Gainesville Atlanta News - FOX 5 Atlanta About Us Meet the FOX 13 team TV Listings Jobs & Internships WTVT History Closed Captioning FCC Public File FCC Applications Contact Us Ybor City Cigar Festival returns to Centennial Park By Regina Gonzalez Published December 8, 2024 5:28pm EST Tampa FOX 13 News Share Copy Link Email Facebook Twitter LinkedIn Reddit TAMPA - The smell of fresh tobacco filled the Ybor City air on Sunday, as the largest cigar festival of its kind took over Centennial Park. "This is the place where all the biggest personalities in the cigar industry brigade to enjoy this amazing festival," said Karen Berger, who traveled from Daytona Beach to sell her own name-brand cigars at the event. Ybor City Cigar Festival at Centennial Park. Cigar aficionados could be seen admiring premium hand-rolled cigars from dozens of global vendors; and, of course, indulged in tastings as they celebrated the craftsmanship and history of the industry that turned Tampa into what it is today. "I was born in Clearwater. I was raised in Tampa. So being part of the cigar community, it means a lot to everyone in the city," said cigar enthusiast Bruce Busch. "This is something special for us to showcase for everyone, not just the United States, but the world, there are people here from Europe right now. We're very proud of it." Statements like that are music to Rob Aguinaga's ears. Decades ago, his grandmother participated in the original cigar festivals of Ybor City. " It's been going on since the 30s. It was called La Verbena," Aguinaga told FOX 13. "They used to go on for a whole week. There was a full parade that brought out 15 or 16,000 people ." Ybor City Cigar Festival at Centennial Park. Aguinaga's mother, Lisa Figueredo, is the founder and publisher of Cigar City Magazine. After changing hands in ownership a few times, their family took over the festival in 2016. Ever since, they've made it bigger and better with the help of presenting sponsors like Arturo Fuente Cigars and J.C. Newman Cigars. But Rob¬†said they still have a grand vision in mind. "We are thinking about maybe next year doing the week-long event and bringing that back to Tampa," Aguinaga added. The historical Society Our Mission Preserve, promote, and celebrate the unique cultural heritage of Ybor City, while honoring Tampa's historic roll in the game of baseball. Our Vision Preserving, promoting, and honoring the unique cultural heritage of Ybor City and Tampa's historic baseball community through educational and community accessible programming. who We are The Ybor City Museum Society, Inc. (YCMS) has been the primary interpreter and conservator of Ybor City's rich history for over 40 years. As of January 2024, YCMS has expanded its mission by rebranding as the Ybor City Historical Society. The Ybor City Historical Society is proud to preserve more than 135 years of Ybor City‚Äôs rich history by operating the Tampa Baseball Museum at the Al Lopez House, offering the Rolling Through History mobile museum program, and creating cultural assets that benefit the community. ‚Äã We believe that valuable lessons and inspiration can be found in the remarkable story of Ybor City, its diverse immigrant roots, and the vibrant community that sprang from humble beginnings. The Ybor City Historical Society partners with our community members to r estore the character of Ybor City through e ducating the community about its history, a dvocating for the current community, and p reserving the cultural heritage for future generations. Support Us Today Board & Staff Code of Ethics DONATE Contact Us PO Box 5421 Tampa, FL 33675 813.247.1434 info@ybormuseum.org Connect with us Facebook Instagram Twitter The Ybor City Museum Society is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, Federal Tax ID No. 59-2274494. Historical pictures are part of the Burgert Broth ers Collection courtesy of USF Special Collection and Hillsborough County Public Library. ¬© 2024 by Ybor City Museum Society. Ybor City gears up for its biggest cigar festival in decades We use cookies to give you the best experience on our site. Learn more or close to accept. √ó Skip to content Stories Guides Events Shop About Stories Guides Events Shop About Search Search COMMUNITY PARTNER Do It , So Tampa Ybor City gears up for its biggest cigar festival in decades December 2, 2024 ‚Ä¢ By Andrew Harlan December 2, 2024 ‚Ä¢ By Andrew Harlan 468 SHARES Facebook Twitter Historic Ybor City is set to host its largest cigar festival in decades on December 8 at Centennial Park (1800 E 8th Ave). Presented by Arturo Fuente Cigars and J.C. Newman Cigars, the 2024 Ybor City Cigar Festival honors the rich tradition of cigar culture in a celebration that promises to be unforgettable. Cigar aficionados can explore premium hand-rolled cigars from global vendors, meet iconic cigar makers, and indulge in tastings. The festival also features live entertainment, cigar-rolling demonstrations, and a variety of food, desserts, and beverages, including beer, wine, and spirits. Local artisans will display unique jewelry, artwork, clothing, and cigar accessories, ensuring there‚Äôs something for everyone. ADVERTISEMENT A free community event celebrating Ybor City history Carlito Fuente Jr., owner of Arturo Fuente Cigars, expressed his pride in the event: ‚ÄúEvery year, it gets bigger and better‚Ä¶ It makes me so proud to be back in Ybor City and see how much it has blossomed.‚Äù With free entry, this event welcomes locals and visitors alike to celebrate Ybor City‚Äôs vibrant history, craftsmanship, and community spirit. Don‚Äôt miss this unique opportunity to experience the legacy of one of the world‚Äôs most iconic cigar traditions! For more details, click here . Andrew Harlan A proud Eckerd College graduate, he‚Äôs a passionate advocate for independent bookstores and St. Petersburg‚Äôs thriving craft coffee scene. When he‚Äôs not working, you‚Äôll find him biking the Pinellas Trail, strolling with his dogs, catching a film at Green Light Cinema, or enjoying long runs along the city‚Äôs award-winning waterfront parks.
